item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Thomas add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Thomas add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My father taught me to work, but not to love it. I never did like to work, and I don't deny it. I'd rather read, tell stories, crack jokes, talk, laugh -- anything but work." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "If you must mount the gallows, give a jest to the crowd, a coin the hangman, and make the drop with a smile on your lips." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Of course Evil's afoot. If it had switched to the metric system it'd be up to a meter by now. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Frank Miller
item.description: "The noir hero is a knight in blood caked armor. He's dirty and he does his best to deny the fact that he's a hero the whole time." -- Frank Miller

item.title: Thomas add a quote by James Patterson
item.description: "Basically, I have two speeds.... Hostile or smart-aleck. Your choice." -- James Patterson

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description: "When you cut pieces out of the truth to avoid looking like a fool you end up looking like a moron instead." -- Robin Hobb

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robin Hobb
item.description: "Thinking is not always...comforting. It is always good, but not always comforting." -- Robin Hobb

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Thomas add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The Creator made women to please the eye, and to boggle the mind." -- Robert Jordan
